lead_paragraph: A federal judge has given a Jets season-ticket holder more time to amend a lawsuit seeking millions from the New England Patriots and Coach Bill Belichick for “deceiving customers” by videotaping opponents’ signals. The lawsuit by Carl J. Mayer, filed in September, was scheduled to be dismissed June 30 because of a lack of activity. Mayer and his co-counsel, Bruce I. Afran, this week asked United States District Judge Garrett E. Brown Jr. for more time because Afran had been ill and because of “revelations” developed by an investigation launched by Senator Arlen Specter, Republican of Pennsylvania, after the lawsuit was filed. They asked permission to serve notice on the defendants by Aug. 30.
